intro: Weberbauera dillonii, commonly known as the Dillon's weberbaueria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Andean region of South America, specifically Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves with a prominent midrib. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
